Enchantments

Enchantments are special magical properties that can appear on weapons in Remixed Dungeon, providing additional effects beyond their base damage and stats.

List of Enchantments

  • Fire - Chance to set enemies on fire on hit
  • Horror - Chance to cause enemies to flee in terror
  • Instability - Random enchantment effect on hit
  • Leech - Heals you for a portion of damage dealt
  • Luck - Increases damage with a chance for extra damage
  • Paralysis - Chance to paralyze enemies on hit
  • Piercing - Chance to hit additional enemies behind the target
  • Poison - Chance to poison enemies on hit
  • Slow - Chance to slow enemies on hit
  • Swing - Hits all adjacent enemies when wielded with two hands
  • Death - Chance to instantly kill non-boss enemies on hit

Identification

  • Enchantments are hidden until a weapon is identified
  • Identified weapons will show their enchantment name
  • Cursed weapons have negative enchantments (curses)

Acquisition

  • Applied automatically when upgrading weapons with Scrolls of Upgrade
  • Process is random - you don't choose which enchantment is applied
  • Higher-level weapons have a higher chance to receive an enchantment when upgraded
  • Only applies to weapons that can receive enchantments

Strategy

  • Identify weapons to reveal enchantments before use
  • Higher-level enchantments have stronger effects
  • Consider your playstyle when choosing weapons with specific enchantments
  • Some enchantments synergize well with specific hero classes

Related

  • Weapons - Equipment that can have enchantments
  • Glyphs - Similar properties for armor
  • Identification - Process to reveal enchantments
  • Upgrading - How to potentially gain enchantments
  • Curses - Negative enchantments on cursed items

Content Verification

  • Information source: Weapon enchantment implementations in Remixed Dungeon
  • All enchantment mechanics verified against actual game code
